attributes.comment:
To whom it may concern:
I am commenting on the current timelines for a I171-H form. The current
restriction is 18 months but due to the increase in time of travel for adopted
families this is not acceptable.
We as prospective parents have already paid the fees and filed all required
documents for international adoption. Unfortunately, with the 18 month restriction
we will not be able to travel to China and return before our I171-H expires. We are
requesting that the timeline of 18 months be changed to 24 months.
It is so hard to deal with the fact of not being able to give birth to our on biological
child. However, adoption has given us hope that we may still become parents. We
have faced many fees, forms and emotions already to make this dream come true.
It seems unfair and immoral to have to now pay additional fees, file more forms
and recomplete fingerprints when we have not even been able to use the I171-H
that we already have.
Please take this into consideration and increase the timeline to 24 months for all
newly filed and existing I171-H applicants. Your attention to this matter is greatly
appreciated.
Sincerely,
Tira Sokovich

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Tira W. Sokovich
